definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known

sentences.english: Having faith that is dedicated to kosen-rufu is what counts.
sentences.chinese: 重要的是“广宣流布的信心”。

sentences.english: Dharma voices sweep over rivers and valleys.
The bad criticism to The Selection of Literary Works by Sushi, affected his spread.
sentences.chinese: 苏轼对《文选》恶评颇多，影响了《文选》的流布。

sentences.english: The Sai drama is a strange ancient opera which was popular in the northern part of Shanxi Province.
sentences.chinese: 赛戏是流布于山西省北部的一个古老奇特的剧种。

sentences.english: Mr Toda was a towering leader of kosen-rufu.
sentences.chinese: 户田先生是广宣流布的伟大领袖。

sentences.english: In the period of Song Dynasties, Literary Selections was spread in the South more flourishingly than in the North.
sentences.chinese: 两宋时《文选》的流布区域呈现南方盛于北方的局面。

definition: (of watercourses) source and direction of flow/origin and development
variant of 敷衍/to elaborate (on a theme)/to expound (the meaning of the classics)
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
